Legal_Issue: Whether Nu-Pharm's process is an obvious chemical equivalent of the '151 patent
Governing_Law: Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations, s. 6
Evidence_Assessment: Affidavits, cross-examinations, and patent documents were analyzed; evidence showed acetone not essential for industrial-scale production
Decision_Outcome: Abbott's application for a prohibition order was granted
Burden_of_Proof: On Abbott to justify allegations of non-infringement based on assumed or proven facts
Credibility_Factor: Evidence from affidavits and cross-examinations assessed for reliability
Legal_Rule: A court must determine if allegations of non-infringement are justified under s. 6 of the Patented Medicines (NOC) Regulations
Standard_of_Review: Based on facts assumed or proven at the time of the patent
Procedural_Issue: Determination of infringement prior to regulatory approval
Grounds_for_Claim: Nu-Pharm’s process alleged to be an obvious chemical equivalent of the patented process
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim of infringement upheld; Nu-Pharm prohibited from proceeding until patent expiry
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Prohibition order granted in favor of Abbott
Review_Standard: Objective assessment of chemical equivalence under existing knowledge
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Parties had opportunity to present evidence and be heard
Key_Evidence_Considered: Chemical process details, temperature variations, use or omission of acetone, scalability without acetone
Applicant_Challenge: Abbott challenged Nu-Pharm’s regulatory submission as infringing
Court_Result: Injunction granted preventing Nu-Pharm from obtaining marketing approval
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory: s. 6 of the Patented Medicines (NOC) Regulations
Defendant_Response: Nu-Pharm argued their process differed by using higher temperatures and no acetone
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, expert affidavits, cross-examination transcripts
Remedy_Requested: Prohibition order to block regulatory approval
Outcome: Remedy granted; Nu-Pharm barred until patent expiration
Decision_Authority: Federal Court (implied by NOC proceeding context)
Resolution_Mechanism: Summary judgment based on affidavit evidence
Legal_Provision: s. 6, Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 6 of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation of infringement based on obvious chemical equivalence
Applicable_Process: NOC proceeding under Canadian patent law
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for prohibition order under NOC Regulations
Governing_Rule: s. 6, Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
